results.title: The Icecream treaty
results.brief_description: The Antarctic Treaty’s aim is to protect the frozen continent whilst allowing peaceful scientific research. Due to renegotiation in 1991, the seven claimants face increasing pressure from a world hungry for the Antarctic’s riches. This video looks at how the people from many countries working there survive in the harsh but stunning surroundings.

results.title: Death and destiny: a Journey into Ancient Egypt
results.brief_description: At Saqqara, just south of the Great Pyramids, lies what is arguably the most important archaeological site in Egypt. At this site, the careful excavation work and detective cunning of an Australian archaeologist has uncovered clues to the assassination of a Pharaoh; a plot that involved court officials, the Pharaoh’s bodyguard and harem. Narrated by Phillip Adams.

results.title: From Opera with Love
results.brief_description: This lively production dispels many widely held misconceptions about opera and shows that it can be as entertaining and exciting as a football match or a bullfight. Excerpts that are featured in this program are from, “the Pirates of Penzance”, “The Magic Flute”, “Carmen”, “Cosi fan tutte” and “The Barber of Seville”. Featuring Graham Blundell and Suzanne Johnston.

results.title: Pop movie. Part 2
results.brief_description: Fremont High School in Elizabeth Park South Australia is a school that is becoming famous for its musical productions. A group of students who are involved in the production of a Rock Musical from casting to preparation of a backdrop which depicts the area in which they live show the fun and sharing that occurs during rehearsals for the show “Type Cast”. Students commence on the breaking down of class level barriers that normally exist in schools, on the ease of communicating with teachers as they learn about devising and producing a pop musical. Positive attitudes are fostered, about self and ability and all regard the experience as “great”!

results.title: Pop movie. Part 1
results.brief_description: A six part series offering an in-depth view of the rock music industry. To those who are fans or aspire to a career in music it is compulsory viewing; and for a more general audience it is an insight into the chaotic world of rock `n’ roll.

results.title: On the loose: three stories about leaving school
results.creator_credit: Jane Oehr, Lyn Norfor and New South Wales. Dept. of Health
results.brief_description: A trilogy about three teenagers seeking their independence in the outside world after finishing school. The three stories show the problems faced by a generation leaving school in the mid 1980s - boredom with school (“Exit Eddie Leech”), sexual pressures in the workplace (“Ring of Confidence”), and keeping a job (“Beginner’s luck”).
results.title_for_label: On the loose: three stories about leaving school
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jane Oehr, Lyn Norfor and New South Wales. Dept. of Health

results.title: Understanding cancer (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Roger Hudson, Jim Dale and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: By considering two basic questions, what is cancer? and what is the cause of cancer?, this program attempts to lay at rest many of the myths about this disease. A very comprehensive coverage of the nature of cancer, epidemiology and carcinogens. Presented by Professor Richard Fox, Ludwig Institute for Cancer Research, University of Sydney.

results.title: The Humble force
results.creator_credit: Geoff Steven, John Maynard, New Zealand National Film Unit and Phase Three Films
results.brief_description: Beyond the Great Wall of China lies “the power of the ancient dynasties and the new red star of communism”. This film explores the juxtaposition of China’s ancient heritage with its continuing advances into technology, communism and subtle trends into westernisation.

results.title: A Killing rain (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Taylor, United Nations Environment Programme and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Acid rain is one aspect of environmental pollution discussed at the Public Hearing in London in 1982. This program travels from Scotland to Scandinavia to West Germany to uncover background causes and the effects of this major pollution problem of the 80s.
